bibl.title: Telegram from S.C. Mead to Mabel H. Lazear, June 22, 1922

div1.p: Mead informs Mabel Lazear that items for the continuation of her annuity have passed both the House and the Senate.

div1.head: Telegram from S.C. Mead to Mabel H. Lazear, June 22, 1922
div1.opener:
Form 1204
CLASS OF SERVICE
SYMBOL
Telegram
Day Letter
Blue
Night Message
Nite
Night Letter
N L
If none of these three symbols
appears after the check (number of
words) this is a telegram. Other-
wise its character is indicated by the
symbol appearing after the check.
WESTERN UNION
WESTERN UNION
TELEGRAM
NEWCOMB CARLTON, PRESIDENT
GEORGE W. E. ATKINS, FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
CLASS OF SERVICE
SYMBOL
Telegram
Day Letter
Blue
Night Message
Nite
Night Letter
N L
If none of these three symbols
appears after the check (number of
words) this is a telegram. Other-
wise its character is indicated by the
symbol appearing after the check.
RECEIVED AT MAIN OFFICE, 826 STATE STREET, SANTA BARBARA, CALIF.
25812/
33 GS, .T 38 1 EXTRA
W NEW YORK NY 1039A JUNE 22 1922
MRS MABEL H LAZEAR
001
218 EAST PADRE ST SANTA BARBARA CALIF
div1.p:
HAVE RECEIVED ADVISE FROM CONGRESSMAN ANTHONY THAT ITEMS FOR CONTINUA-
TION OF ANNUITY ARE INCLUDED IN ARMY APPROPRIATION BILL HAVING PASSED
BOTH THE HOUSE AND SENATE AND THEREFORE WILL ALMOST SURELY BE
CONTINUED IN BILL AS FINALLY PASSED
div1.closer:
S C MEAD
SECY 804A
Phoned to Self
Time 8.10 a
98
7
